1.text: Doth not wisdom cry aloud, and prudence put forth her voice ?

2.text: Standing in the top of the highest places by the way, in the midst of the paths.

3.text: Beside the gates of the city, in the very doors she speaketh, saying:

4.text: O ye men, to you I call, and my voice is to the sons of men.

5.text: O little ones, understand subtilty, and ye unwise, take notice.

6.text: Hear, for I will speak of great things: and my lips shall be opened to preach right things.

7.text: My mouth shall meditate truth, and my lips shall hate wickedness.

8.text: All my words are just, there is nothing wicked nor perverse in them.

9.text: They are right to them that understand, and just to them that find knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction, and not money: choose knowledge rather than gold.

11.text: 11For wisdom is better than all the most precious things: and whatsoever may be desired cannot be compared to

12.text: I wisdom dwell in counsel, and am present in learned thoughts.

13.text: The fear of the Lord hateth evil: I hate arrogance, and pride, and every wicked way, and a mouth with a double tongue.

14.text: Counsel and equity is mine, prudence is mine, strength is mine.

15.text: By me kings reign, and lawgivers decree just things,

16.text: By me princes rule, and the mighty decree justice.

17.text: I love them that love me: and they that in the morning early watch for me, shall find me.

18.text: With me are riches and glory, glorious riches and justice.

19.text: For my fruit is better than gold and the precious stone, and my blossoms than choice silver.

20.text: I walk in the way of justice, in the midst of the paths of judgment,

21.text: That I may enrich them that love me, and may fill their treasures.

22.text: The Lord possessed me in the beginning of his ways, before he made any thing from the beginning.

23.text: I was set up from eternity, and of old before the earth was made.

24.text: The depths were not as yet, and I was already conceived. neither had the fountains of waters as yet sprung out:

25.text: The mountains with their huge bulk had not as yet been established: before the hills I was brought forth:

26.text: He had not yet made the earth, nor the rivers, nor the poles of the world.

27.text: When he prepared the heavens, I was present: when with a certain law and compass he enclosed the depths:

28.text: When he established the sky above, and poised the fountains of waters:

29.text: When he compassed the sea with its bounds, and set a law to the waters that they should not pass their limits: when be balanced the foundations of the earth;

30.text: I was with him forming all things: and was delighted every day, playing before him at all times;

31.text: Playing in the world: and my delights were to be with the children of men.

32.text: Now therefore, ye children, hear me: Blessed are they that keep my ways.

33.text: Hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.

34.text: Blessed is the man that heareth me, and that watcheth daily at my gates, and waiteth at the posts of my doors.

35.text: He that shall find me, shall find life, and shall have salvation from the Lord:

36.text: But he that shall sin against me, shall hurt his own soul. All that hate me love death.
